content: our local knitting guild the needlework guild of canada very graciously invited me to attend their first knit in the park so i whipped up a little kit for them a pumpkin beanie we figured it s timely what with harvest season approaching plus there is no child ever who isn t adorable in a pumpkin hat since our guild knits for charity we wanted it to be something that was gender-neutral and makes a great gift for anyone we sized the hat from preemie to kids of all ages and you should be able to get 2 pumpkin hats out of one kit and probably a third green hat too the yarn is the ever soft and berroco vintage but if you want to upgrade go for the combo we assembled with malabrigo rios **skill level ** advanced beginner the skill level to be accessible to knitters in the beginner spectrum so there isn t any colourwork or charts you just need the following skills read a knitting pattern cast on & bind off knit & purl in the same row work in the round on circular & double pointed needles weave in ends see our curated list of knitting skills for tutorials **size** - preemie 0-6 mos 6-18mos 18mos-4yrs 4yrs-adult s - to fit head circumference 14 5 16 75 18 20 5 21 5 or 36 42 45 51 54 cm - note fabric is stretchy if you want a tighter fit go down a needle size - photo is size 0-6mos after blocking measures 7 75 wide **gauge** 20 sts & 26 rounds = 4 /10cm with 4 5mm/us7 circular needles after blocking **materials** - berroco vintage or malabrigo rios 1 skein in each of 2 colours - our sample is made with vintage mc 5176 pumpkin & cc 51174 spruce - pattern - 4 5mm/us7-16 circular needles - 3 75mm/us5-16 circular needles for brim - 4 5mm/us7 double pointed needles - stitch markers - darning needle
